summary: In math, the continuous uniform distribution is a type of probability distribution where any outcome within a range is equally likely. It's like a rectangle with a minimum and maximum value (a and b) as its corners. This distribution is often written as U(a, b). The distance between a and b is the interval length, and all intervals of the same length are equally possible. It's a simple way to describe random experiments with no specific pattern.
title: Continuous uniform distribution
